caption: Task Instructions
text:
In this short survey we will ask you questions about longitudinal studies in crowdsourcing platforms.

A longitudinal study is a series of tasks from the same requester which are published regularly over time and require the same workers to participate.

For example, a requester may require workers to complete a short survey about alcohol consumption every week over a duration of 6 months, in order to collect data about how sports can help with reducing alcohol intake. As another example, consider a requester who asks workers to use a tool to complete a certain number of tasks every day in a week to understand how familiarity with the tool influences their task completion. 

Whether you have experience with this type of task in the past or not, feel free to complete the survey and tell us about your opinion and experience.
